sen.j: 日蓮宗（にちれんしゅう）とは、鎌倉時代に日蓮によって興された仏教宗派。
sen.e: Nichiren sect is a Buddhism sect founded by Nichiren in the Kamakura period.
The Nichiren sect is a Buddhist sect founded by Nichiren in the Kamakura period.
The Nichiren sect is a Buddhist sect founded by Nichiren in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 法華宗とも称する。
sen.e: It is also called the Hokke sect.
It is also called the Hokke sect.
It is also called the Hokke sect.

sen.j: 今日における狭義では、日蓮を宗祖とする諸宗派の最大宗派「宗教法人日蓮宗」を指す。
sen.e: In a narrow sense today, it refers to 'Religious Corporation Nichiren sect' which is the largest sect among the sects that regard Nichiren as the founder.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In a narrow sense, today it refers to 'Religious Corporation Nichiren sect,' the largest sect among the sects saying Nichiren was their founder.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: In a narrow sense, today it refers to 'Religious Corporation Nichiren sect,' the largest sect among the sects saying Nichiren was their founder.

sen.j: 総本山を身延山久遠寺（くおんじ）とし宗務院を池上本門寺（東京都大田区池上）に置く。
sen.e: Sohonzan (the head temple of a Buddhist sect) is the Minobusan Kuon-ji Temple and Shumuin Propagation Hall is in the Ikegami Honmon-ji Temple (Ikegami, Ota Ward, Tokyo Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Sohonzan (head temple) of the Nichiren sect is Kuon-ji Temple located on Mt. Minobu and the Shumuin (propagation hall) is in Ikegami Honmon-ji Temple (Ikegami, Ota Ward, Tokyo Prefecture).
The Sohonzan (head temple) of the Nichiren sect is Kuon-ji Temple located on Mt. Minobu and the Shumuin (propagation hall) is in Ikegami Honmon-ji Temple (Ikegami, Ota Ward, Tokyo Prefecture).

sen.j: 57総本山、大本山、本山の連合宗派。
sen.e: It is an union of sect consisting of 57 temples of Sohonzan, Daihonzan (head temple of a Buddhist sect) and head temples.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is the union of sects, and consists of 57 temples of Sohonzan (the head temple of the upper rank), Daihonzan (the head temples of the middle rank) and Honzan (the head temples of the lower rank).
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: It is the union of sects, and consists of 57 temples of Sohonzan (the head temple of the upper rank), Daihonzan (the head temples of the middle rank) and Honzan (the head temples of the lower rank).

sen.j: 「釈迦本仏論と一致派」、「釈迦本仏論と勝劣派」、「宗祖本仏論と勝劣派」など教義の異なる諸門流を包含する日蓮系諸宗派中の最大宗派。
sen.e: Among various sects of Nichiren sect, it is the largest sect including various mon-ryu (school of a sect) which have a different dharma such as 'Shaka Honbutsuron [a believing Shakyamuni as the True Buddha] and Icchi school,' 'Shaka Honbutsuron and Shoretsu school' and 'Shuso Honbutsuron [a believing Nichiren as the True Buddha] and Shoretsu school.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is the largest sect among the various Nichiren sects which includes various monryu (school of a sect) having different doctrines such as 'the school of Shaka Honbutsu-ron (the idea Shakya-muni is the True Buddha) and Icchi-ha (the idea the thought of shakumon and honmon is the same),' 'the school of Shaka Honbutsu-ron and Shoretsu-ha (the idea the thought of honmon is better than shakumon)' and 'the school of Shuso Honbutsu-ron (the idea Nichiren is the True Buddha) and Shoretsu-ha.'
sen.cmt: 誤訳に対応しました。スタイルの統一。
sen.e: It is the largest sect among the various Nichiren sects which includes various monryu (school of a sect) having different doctrines such as 'the school of Shaka Honbutsu-ron (the idea Shakya-muni is the True Buddha) and Icchi-ha (the idea the thought of shakumon and honmon is the same),' 'the school of Shaka Honbutsu-ron and Shoretsu-ha (the idea the thought of honmon is better than shakumon)' and 'the school of Shuso Honbutsu-ron (the idea Nichiren is the True Buddha) and Shoretsu-ha.'

sen.j: 寺院数5,200ヶ寺、直系信徒330万人。
sen.e: It has 5,200 temples and 3,300,000 believers.
It has 5,200 temples and 3,300,000 believers.
It has 5,200 temples and 3,300,000 believers.

sen.j: 教義
sen.e: Dharma
Dharma
Dharma

sen.j: 釈迦の説いた法の極意が法華経にあるという中国の智ギの教相判釈に基づく。
sen.e: It depends on Kyoso Hanjaku (evaluation of sutras) written by Zhi-yi in China, which considers that the secret of Buddhism taught by Shakyamuni exists in Hokke-kyo Sutra (the Lotus Sutra).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It developed from Kyoso Hanjaku (the evaluation of sutras) by Priest Zhiyi in China, who said that the secret of Buddhism had been taught by Shakya-muni existed in Hokke-kyo (Saddharmapundariika-sutra, the Lotus Sutra).
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。僧「ちぎ」に「-」は不要。
sen.e: It developed from Kyoso Hanjaku (the evaluation of sutras) by Priest Zhiyi in China, who said that the secret of Buddhism had been taught by Shakya-muni existed in Hokke-kyo (Saddharmapundariika-sutra, the Lotus Sutra).

sen.j: 鳩摩羅什（くまらじゅう）訳『妙法蓮華経』を所依の経典とする。
sen.e: It is based on "Myohorenge-kyo Sutra" (the Lotus Sutra) which was translated by Kumaraju.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is based on "Myohorenge-kyo" (Saddharmapundariika-sutra, Miaofa Lianhua-jing, the Lotus Sutra) which was translated by Kumaraju (Kumaarajiiva).
It is based on "Myohorenge-kyo" (Saddharmapundariika-sutra, Miaofa Lianhua-jing, the Lotus Sutra) which was translated by Kumaraju (Kumaarajiiva).

sen.j: 日蓮は、いかなる凡夫にも「仏性」が秘められており、「南無妙法蓮華経」（なむ・みょうほうれんげきょう）と題目を唱える「唱題」の行 (仏教)を行えば「仏性」が顕現するという思想を説いた。
sen.e: Nichiren taught the idea that any Bonpu (unenlightened person) keeps 'bussho' (the Buddhist nature) and that if he performs the practice of 'shodai,' that is, chanting Nichiren chant of 'Nam Myoho Renge-kyo,' his 'bussho' would appear.

Nichiren taught the idea that any unenlightened person kept 'bussho' (the Buddhist nature) in the inside of him and once he performed a Buddhist practice (called 'gyo') of chanting the Nichiren chant 'Nam Myohorenge-kyo' (called 'shodai'), 'bussho' would appear on the outside of him.
sen.cmt: 用語の統一。わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: Nichiren taught the idea that any unenlightened person kept 'bussho' (the Buddhist nature) in the inside of him and once he performed a Buddhist practice (called 'gyo') of chanting the Nichiren chant 'Nam Myohorenge-kyo' (called 'shodai'), 'bussho' would appear on the outside of him.

sen.j: 宗祖日蓮以降、本仏の位置付けや、所依の妙法蓮華経に対し勝劣の別を設けるかどうかなどの点から、思想面では大別して3つの分派が成立した。
sen.e: After the death of Nichiren, the founder of sect, roughly three branch groups in theory were established in the viewpoint of the status of honbutsu and whether to make a difference on mastery in the fundamental 'Nam Myoho Renge-kyo.'

After the death of the founder Nichiren, the differences of the thoughts about honbutsu (the true Buddha) and of the thoughts about the relative merit of the early part and the latter part of "Myohorenge-kyo" made branch groups which is roughly divided into three schools.

After the death of the founder Nichiren, the differences of the thoughts about honbutsu (the true Buddha) and of the thoughts about the relative merit of the early part and the latter part of "Myohorenge-kyo" made branch groups which is roughly divided into three schools.

sen.j: 本仏について
sen.e: About honbutsu
About honbutsu
About honbutsu

sen.j: 久遠實成本師釈迦牟尼仏を指す
sen.e: It refers to Kuon Jitsujo Honshi Shakyamuni butsu.
sen.cmt: 實成の読み方不明です。
sen.e: It refers to Kuon Jitsujo Honshi Shakyamuni butsu.
It refers to Kuon Jitsujo Honshi Shakyamuni butsu.

sen.j: 一致派と勝劣派
sen.e: Icchi school and Shoretsu school
Icchi school and Shoretsu school
Icchi school and Shoretsu school

sen.j: 所依の妙法蓮華経を構成する二十八品（28章）は前半の「迹門」、後半の「本門」に二分される。
sen.e: The 28 hon (chapters) of fundamental Myohorenge-kyo Sutra are divided into the early part of 'Shakumon' (the Trace Gate) and the latter part of 'Honmon' (the Source Gate).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Nijuhachi-bon (twenty-eight chapters) forming Myohorenge-kyo are divided into two part; the early part is called 'Shakumon' (the Trace Gate) and the latter part is called 'Honmon' (the Source Gate).
Nijuhachi-bon (twenty-eight chapters) forming Myohorenge-kyo are divided into two part; the early part is called 'Shakumon' (the Trace Gate) and the latter part is called 'Honmon' (the Source Gate).

sen.j: 本門に法華経の極意があるとするのが勝劣派、二十八品全体を一体のものとして扱うべきとするのが一致派。
sen.e: Shoretsu school considers that the secret of Hokke-kyo exists in Honmon, while Icchi school insists that all 28 hon should be treated as a unit.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Shoretsu school considers that the secret of Hokke-kyo exists in Honmon, while Icchi school insists that the whole Nijuhachi-bon should be treated as a unit.
Shoretsu school considers that the secret of Hokke-kyo exists in Honmon, while Icchi school insists that the whole Nijuhachi-bon should be treated as a unit.

sen.j: 現在、日蓮宗を構成している祖山1(総本山）、霊蹟寺院14（大本山7、本山7）、由緒寺院42（本山42）については上記各門流を抱合している。
sen.e: The members of today's Nichiren sect, that is, one Sozan (Sohonzan), 14 Reisekijiin (7 Daihonzan and 7 head temples) and 42 Yuisho jiin (temple of a long history) (42 head temples), include above each mon-ryu.

Today some temples belong to the Nichiren sect including one Sozan (Sohonzan), fourteen Reiseki-jiin (temples having holy relic including seven Daihonzan and seven Honzan) and fourty-two Yuisho-jiin (temples of a long history including fourty-two Honzan) accept such schools.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。用語の統一。
sen.e: Today some temples belong to the Nichiren sect including one Sozan (Sohonzan), fourteen Reiseki-jiin (temples having holy relic including seven Daihonzan and seven Honzan) and fourty-two Yuisho-jiin (temples of a long history including fourty-two Honzan) accept such schools.

sen.j: 明治維新直後の廃仏毀釈の後、明治政府は仏教各派に対し一宗一管長制を打ち出し、統一教団の結成を要求。
sen.e: After Haibutsu-kishaku (a movement to abolish Buddhism) soon after the Meiji restoration, the Meiji government announced a system in which each sect was allowed only one chief abbot against each Buddhist sect and requested to form an integrated religious community.

After executing Haibutsu-kishaku (a movement to abolish Buddhism) soon after the Meiji restoration, the Meiji government announced 'Isshu Ichikanncho-sei' (the system of one chief abbot in one sect) to each Buddhist sect, and ordered them to form an integrated religious community.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: After executing Haibutsu-kishaku (a movement to abolish Buddhism) soon after the Meiji restoration, the Meiji government announced 'Isshu Ichikanncho-sei' (the system of one chief abbot in one sect) to each Buddhist sect, and ordered them to form an integrated religious community.

sen.j: 日蓮系の諸門流は、1872年（明治5年）、日蓮宗を形成した。
sen.e: So in 1872 the schools and sects originated from Nichiren established the Nichiren sect.
So in 1872 the schools and sects originated from Nichiren established the Nichiren sect.
So in 1872 the schools and sects originated from Nichiren established the Nichiren sect.

sen.j: この日蓮宗は、1874年（明治7年）、教義の違いから日蓮宗一致派と日蓮宗勝劣派に二分した。
sen.e: In 1874 this Nichiren sect was split into Icchi school of the Nichiren sect and Shoretsu school of the Nichiren sect because of the difference of dharma.

In 1874 this Nichiren sect was split into Nichirenshu Icchi-ha (Icchi school of the Nichiren sect) and Nichirenshu Shoretsu-ha (Shoretsu school of the Nichiren sect) because of the difference of the dharma.

In 1874 this Nichiren sect was split into Nichirenshu Icchi-ha (Icchi school of the Nichiren sect) and Nichirenshu Shoretsu-ha (Shoretsu school of the Nichiren sect) because of the difference of the dharma.

sen.j: 1876年（明治9年）、一致派は日蓮宗と改称、「釈尊を本仏とする一致派」(日向門流、日常門流など)の統一教団として再組織された。
sen.e: In 1876, the Icchi school changed the name into Nichiren sect and was reorganized as an integrated religious community of 'Icchi school which regards Shakyamuni as honbutsu' (such as Niko mon-ryu, Nichijo mon-ryu).

In 1876, the Icchi school changed the name into the Nichiren sect and was reorganized as an integrated religious community of 'the Icchi school which regards Shakya-muni as honbutsu' including the Niko school and the Nichijo school.

In 1876, the Icchi school changed the name into the Nichiren sect and was reorganized as an integrated religious community of 'the Icchi school which regards Shakya-muni as honbutsu' including the Niko school and the Nichijo school.

sen.j: 1941年（昭和16年）、時局緊迫を理由に政府当局が教祖、宗祖や教義を同じくする諸宗教、諸宗派に統合を迫る。
sen.e: In 1941 the government urged various religions and sects which had the same founder of religion or sect and dharma to consolidate because of the emergency situation.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1941 the government ordered in the name of the state of emergency that the religions and sects having the same founder of religion or the same founder of sect or the same dharma should be consolidated.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: In 1941 the government ordered in the name of the state of emergency that the religions and sects having the same founder of religion or the same founder of sect or the same dharma should be consolidated.

sen.j: このような時勢の後押しを受け、「釈尊を本仏とする勝劣派」である顕本法華宗（日什門流）「日蓮を本仏とする勝劣派」である本門宗（日興門流）と、日蓮宗が、形式上、それぞれの宗派を解消して対等の立場で合併（三派合同）。
sen.e: On the background of such situation, Kenpon Hokke sect (Nichiju mon-ryu) which is 'Shoretsu school that considers Shakyamuni as honbutsu,' Honmon Shu (Nikko mon-ryu) which is 'Shoretsu school that considers Nichiren as honbutsu,' and Nichiren sect formally dissolved each sect and merged on an equal footing (the merger of three schools).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Against the background of such situation, the three sects including the Kenpon-hokke sect (the Nichiju school) which was 'the Shoretsu school saying Shakya-muni was honbutsu,' the Honmon sect (the Nikko school) which was 'the Shoretsu school saying Nichiren was honbutsu,' and the Nichiren sect formally dissolved each sect and merged on an equal footing (the merger of three schools).

Against the background of such situation, the three sects including the Kenpon-hokke sect (the Nichiju school) which was 'the Shoretsu school saying Shakya-muni was honbutsu,' the Honmon sect (the Nikko school) which was 'the Shoretsu school saying Nichiren was honbutsu,' and the Nichiren sect formally dissolved each sect and merged on an equal footing (the merger of three schools).

sen.j: 中世期に成立していた門流の多くと、思想的潮流の相当部分を包含する新生日蓮宗が結成された。
sen.e: As a result, a new Nichiren sect which included many mon-ryu and most of the streams on ideology was established.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a result, a new Nichiren sect was established including many schools and various thoughts which had been formed in the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れに対応しました。
sen.e: As a result, a new Nichiren sect was established including many schools and various thoughts which had been formed in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦終戦により「統合を強要する圧力」が消滅したりするのに伴い、旧顕本法華宗、旧本門宗に属する本山、末寺には日蓮宗より独立するものもあった。
sen.e: After the end of the World War II, 'a pressure which urged integration' disappeared and some head temples and branch temples which belonged to the former Kenpon Hokke sect and the former Honmon Shu became independent.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the end of World War II, 'the pressure which had forced the integration' disappeared, and some head temples and branch temples which belonged to the former Kenpon-hokke sect and the former the Honmon sect left the Nichiren sect to become independent temples.
sen.cmt: 用語の統一。わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: After the end of World War II, 'the pressure which had forced the integration' disappeared, and some head temples and branch temples which belonged to the former Kenpon-hokke sect and the former the Honmon sect left the Nichiren sect to become independent temples.

sen.j: が、旧顕本法華宗の改革派である本山妙國寺、本山本興寺、本山玄妙寺、本山妙立寺、や、旧本門宗の大本山重須本門寺、本山小泉久遠寺、本山柳瀬実成寺とそれらの末寺は引き続き、日蓮宗の内部で固有の教義を維持し続けている。
sen.e: However, the head temples of Myokoku-ji Temple, Honko-ji Temple, Genmyo-ji Temple and Myoritsu-ji Temple which are reformists of the former Kenpon Hokke Shu, and Daihonzan Omosu Honmon-ji Temple, the head temple Koizumi Kuon-ji Temple and the head temple Yanase Jitsujo-ji Temple which are the former Honmon Shu and their branch temples have internally continued to maintain their original dharma in the Nichiren sect.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, some temples have been keeping their original dharma without leaving the Nichiren sect; the followings are such temples; the reformist Honzan (head temple of the lower rank) of the former Kenpon-hokke sect including Myokoku-ji Temple, Honko-ji Temple, Genmyo-ji Temple and Myoritsu-ji Temple and their branch temples; the Daihonzan of the former Honmon sect, Omosu Honmon-ji Temple, and the Honzan of the same sect including Koizumi Kuon-ji Temple and Yanase Jitsujo-ji Temple and their branch temples.

However, some temples have been keeping their original dharma without leaving the Nichiren sect; the followings are such temples; the reformist Honzan (head temple of the lower rank) of the former Kenpon-hokke sect including Myokoku-ji Temple, Honko-ji Temple, Genmyo-ji Temple and Myoritsu-ji Temple and their branch temples; the Daihonzan of the former Honmon sect, Omosu Honmon-ji Temple, and the Honzan of the same sect including Koizumi Kuon-ji Temple and Yanase Jitsujo-ji Temple and their branch temples.

sen.j: 日蓮に対する天台教学の影響
sen.e: The influence of Tendai doctrine against Nichiren
The influence of Tendai Doctrine on Nichiren
The influence of Tendai Doctrine on Nichiren

sen.j: 仏性
sen.e: Bussho
Bussho
Bussho

sen.j: 仏性という用語は妙法蓮華経にはみえない。
sen.e: The term 'bussho' is not found in Myohorenge-kyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The term 'bussho' is not found in Myohorenge-kyo.
The term 'bussho' is not found in Myohorenge-kyo.

sen.j: これは仏性が初めて説かれる中期大乗経典の大般涅槃経を依経とする涅槃宗を中国天台宗が吸収したことによるものと考えられる。
sen.e: It can be thought that this is because Chinese Tendai sect incorporated the Nehan Sect, which depended on the Nirvana Sutra, that is, Mahayana Sutra in the middle period in which the term bussho appeared for the first time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It can be thought that this is because Chinese Tendai sect (Tiantai-zong) incorporated the Nehan sect (Niepan-zong) which was based on "Daihatsu Nehan-gyo" (Daban Niepan-jing, the Nirvana Sutra), one of Mahayana Sutra of the middle period, in which the term 'bussho' (仏性foxing) appeared for the first time.

It can be thought that this is because Chinese Tendai sect (Tiantai-zong) incorporated the Nehan sect (Niepan-zong) which was based on "Daihatsu Nehan-gyo" (Daban Niepan-jing, the Nirvana Sutra), one of Mahayana Sutra of the middle period, in which the term 'bussho' (仏性foxing) appeared for the first time.

sen.j: 法華経の位置付け
sen.e: The position of Hokke-kyo Sutra
The Thought on Hokke-kyo
The Thought on Hokke-kyo

sen.j: 法華経の位置付けは、中国天台宗の流れを汲む天台宗の宗祖最澄の開いた比叡山延暦寺での修行の影響とされる。
sen.e: The position of Hokke-kyo Sutra is said to be influenced by the ascetic practices at the Enryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Hiei which was founded by Saicho, the founder of the Tendai sect which was the lineage of Chinese Tendai sect.

It is believed that since Nichiren had studied at Enryaku-ji Temple located on Mt. Hiei which had been established by Saicho, the founder of the Tendai sect originated from Chinese Tendai sect, Nichiren emphasized Hokke-kyo.

It is believed that since Nichiren had studied at Enryaku-ji Temple located on Mt. Hiei which had been established by Saicho, the founder of the Tendai sect originated from Chinese Tendai sect, Nichiren emphasized Hokke-kyo.

sen.j: そもそも仏教は、開祖である釈迦の教えをその死後に弟子達が書き顕した膨大な量の経典に基づいている。
sen.e: Originally, Buddhism is based on a huge amount of Buddhist scriptures in which the teaching of Shakyamuni, the founder of religion, was written by his disciples after his death.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Originally, Buddhism was based on a huge amount of Buddhist scriptures in which the teaching of Shakya-muni, the founder of the religion, was written by his disciples after his death.
Originally, Buddhism was based on a huge amount of Buddhist scriptures in which the teaching of Shakya-muni, the founder of the religion, was written by his disciples after his death.

sen.j: 一般には、それらを全て読破することは勿論、ましてや全ての意味を正確に理解することなどはきわめて困難である。
sen.e: Generally, it is very difficult to read all of them and understood all the meaning correctly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Generally, it is very difficult to read all of them and understood all the meaning correctly.
Generally, it is very difficult to read all of them and understood all the meaning correctly.

sen.j: 中国では、さまざまな宗派が乱立していく中で、「一体どの仏典が仏教の一番肝心な教えなのか」という論点が仏教者の間で次第に唯一最大の関心事となっていったことは、ある意味、時代の必然であったと言える。
sen.e: Considering the social situation that various sects scattered in China, it was natural that 'which Buddhist scripture is the most important in Buddhism' had gradually become the sole biggest problem among Buddhist.

Considering the social situation that too many sects were founded in China, it was natural that 'which Buddhist scripture was the most important in Buddhism' had gradually become the sole biggest problem among Buddhist.

Considering the social situation that too many sects were founded in China, it was natural that 'which Buddhist scripture was the most important in Buddhism' had gradually become the sole biggest problem among Buddhist.

sen.j: 天台大師智顗（ちぎ）は長年にわたる経典研究の結果、法華経（サンスクリット語名「サッダルマ・プンダリーカ・スートラ」（「正しい法"白き蓮の花"」の意）を、釈迦が七十数歳にして到達した最高の教えであると結論付けた。
sen.e: As a result of long research of Buddhist scriptures, Tendai Daishi Zhiyi concluded that Hokke-kyo Sutra ('sad dharma pundarika sutra' in Sanskrit which means 'right dharma "white lotus flower"') was the supreme teaching which Shakyamuni reached at the age of over 70.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For a long time researched Buddhist scriptures, Great Priest Zhiyi of Tiantai concluded that Hokke-kyo ('sad dharma pundarika sutra' in Sanskrit which means 'right dharma, white lotus flower') was the supreme teaching which Shakya-muni had reached at the age of over 70.

For a long time researched Buddhist scriptures, Great Priest Zhiyi of Tiantai concluded that Hokke-kyo ('sad dharma pundarika sutra' in Sanskrit which means 'right dharma, white lotus flower') was the supreme teaching which Shakya-muni had reached at the age of over 70.

sen.j: とりわけ鳩摩羅什（くまらじゅう）の手が入ったと言われる漢訳「妙法蓮華経」を最もすぐれた翻訳とした。
sen.e: Especially, he considered that the 'Myohorenge-kyo Sutra' which was said to be translated into Chinese by Kumaraju was the best translation.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Especially, he considered that "Myohorenge-kyo" ("Miaofa Lianhua-jing" commonly translated as "the Lotus Sutra") which was said to have been translated into Chinese by Kumaraju (Kumaarajiiva) was the best translation.

Especially, he considered that "Myohorenge-kyo" ("Miaofa Lianhua-jing" commonly translated as "the Lotus Sutra") which was said to have been translated into Chinese by Kumaraju (Kumaarajiiva) was the best translation.

sen.j: こうした天台大師智顗の思想の影響を受けて日蓮は法華経を最高の経典とした、という見方が一般的である。
sen.e: It is generally thought that affected by such an idea of Tendai Daishi Zhiyi, Nichiren regarded the Hokke-kyo Sutra as the supreme Buddhist scripture.
It is generally thought that since being affected by such idea of Priest Zhiyi of Tiantai, Nichiren regarded Hokke-kyo (Myohorenge-kyo) as the supreme Buddhist scripture.
It is generally thought that since being affected by such idea of Priest Zhiyi of Tiantai, Nichiren regarded Hokke-kyo (Myohorenge-kyo) as the supreme Buddhist scripture.

sen.j: と同時に日蓮の心理的内面に即して言えば、何よりも彼は、法華経に書かれている行者の姿と自身の生活の軌跡が符合したことに最大の根拠を見出して、上行菩薩（本佛釈尊より弘通の委嘱を受けた本化地涌菩薩の上首）としての自覚を得るに至ったのである（上行応生）。
sen.e: At the same time, based on the mental aspect of Nichiren, he became aware of Jogyo Bosatsu (Superior Practice Bodhisattva) (Joshu [the head of a group] of Honge Jiyu Bosatsu who was asked to do guzu or gutsu [missionary activities] by honbutsu Shakyamuni), the biggest reason of which was because the figure of practitioners in the Hokke-kyo Sutra corresponded to his own life (Jogyo Ojo).

At the same time, based on the mental aspect of Nichiren, it is considered that since he found the life of the ascetic described in Hokke-kyo and his own life was the same, he became aware of being 'Jogyo Bosatsu' (the head of 'Honge-jiyu Bosatsu,' Bodhisattva who had to assist Shakya-muni in the mission) (called 'Jogyo Ojo').
sen.cmt: 用語の統一。わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: At the same time, based on the mental aspect of Nichiren, it is considered that since he found the life of the ascetic described in Hokke-kyo and his own life was the same, he became aware of being 'Jogyo Bosatsu' (the head of 'Honge-jiyu Bosatsu,' Bodhisattva who had to assist Shakya-muni in the mission) (called 'Jogyo Ojo').

sen.j: 主要寺院
sen.e: Major temples
Major temples
Major temples

sen.j: 現在の日蓮宗宗制では寺院は祖山、霊蹟寺院、由緒寺院、一般寺院に分けられている。
sen.e: Under the religious system of the present Nichiren sect, temples are classified into Sozan, Reisekijiin, Yuishojiin and common temples.
Under the present religious system of the Nichiren sect, temples are classified into Sozan, Reiseki-jiin, Yuisho-jiin and Ippan-jiin (common temples).
sen.cmt: 用語の統一。「一般寺院」の他は前段で説明済み。
sen.e: Under the present religious system of the Nichiren sect, temples are classified into Sozan, Reiseki-jiin, Yuisho-jiin and Ippan-jiin (common temples).

sen.j: 江戸時代の本末制度に始まる寺格は昭和16年の本末解体で消滅し実態はない。
sen.e: Jikaku (status of a Buddhist temple), which was originated from Honmatsu-seido (the government-enforced main-branch temple system) in the Edo period, was dissolved in 1941 and does not exist now.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Jikaku (status of a Buddhist temple), which was originated from Honmatsu-seido (the government-enforced main-branch temple system) in the Edo period, was dissolved in 1941 and does not exist now.
Jikaku (status of a Buddhist temple), which was originated from Honmatsu-seido (the government-enforced main-branch temple system) in the Edo period, was dissolved in 1941 and does not exist now.

sen.j: が、日蓮宗宗制では総本山・大本山・本山の称号を用いることができると規定されている。
sen.e: However, the religious system of the Nichiren sect prescribes that temples can use the titles of Sohonzan, Daihonzan and head temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the religious system of the Nichiren sect prescribes that each temple can use the title of Sohonzan or Daihonzan or Honzan.
sen.cmt: 用語の統一。称号について前段で説明済み。
sen.e: However, the religious system of the Nichiren sect prescribes that each temple can use the title of Sohonzan or Daihonzan or Honzan.

sen.j: 祖山は日蓮の遺言に従い遺骨が埋葬された祖廟がある身延山久遠寺（日蓮棲神の霊山とされる）で、貫首を法主と称する。
sen.e: Sozan is the Minobusan Kuon-ji Temple (which is considered to be the sacred mountain where Nichiren as a god lives) where Nichiren's cremains were buried, following his will and the head priest of which is called hoshu.

Sozan' is Kuon-ji Temple located on Mt. Minobu (which is considered to be the sacred mountain where Nichiren as a god lives) where Nichiren's remains were buried by his will, and Kanju (the head priest) of Sozan is called 'Hoshu.'

Sozan' is Kuon-ji Temple located on Mt. Minobu (which is considered to be the sacred mountain where Nichiren as a god lives) where Nichiren's remains were buried by his will, and Kanju (the head priest) of Sozan is called 'Hoshu.'

sen.j: 霊蹟寺院は日蓮一代の重要な事跡、由緒寺院は宗門史上顕著な沿革のある寺院で、住職(法律上の代表役員）を貫首と称する（中山法華経寺では伝主とされている）。
sen.e: Reisekijiin is the important site of Nichiren and Yuishojiin has a distinguished history in the history of the sect, and both head priests (legal representative board) are called kanshu (it is called denshu in the Nakayama Hokkekyo-ji Temple).

Reiseki-jiin' is the important site of Nichiren and 'Yuisho-jiin' has a distinguished history in the history of the sect, and both head priests (legal representative board) are called 'Kanju' (in Nakayama Hokkekyo-ji Temple, the head priest is called 'Denshu').

Reiseki-jiin' is the important site of Nichiren and 'Yuisho-jiin' has a distinguished history in the history of the sect, and both head priests (legal representative board) are called 'Kanju' (in Nakayama Hokkekyo-ji Temple, the head priest is called 'Denshu').

sen.j: 祖山、霊蹟寺院、由緒寺院は「日蓮宗全国本山会」を組織している。
sen.e: Sozan, Reisekijiin and Yuishojiin organizes 'Nichiren Sect Head Temples Association of Japan.'
Sozan, Reiseki-jiin and Yuisho-jiin organize 'the Nichiren Sect Head Temples Association of Japan.'
Sozan, Reiseki-jiin and Yuisho-jiin organize 'the Nichiren Sect Head Temples Association of Japan.'

sen.j: 総裁は身延山久遠寺内野日總法主（潮師法縁）、会長は妙厳山本覚寺永倉日侃貫首（潮師法縁）、事務局は現在臨時として小松原鏡忍寺に設置されている。
sen.e: The president is Nisso (日總) UCHINO(潮師法縁), the hoshu of Minobusan Kuon-ji Temple, and the chairman is Nikkan NAGAKURA (潮師法縁), the kanshu of Myogonzan Hongaku-ji Temple, and the office is temporarily located in the Kyonin-ji Temple at present.
sen.cmt: 日總、潮師法縁の読み方不明です。
sen.e: The president is Nisso UCHINO (hoen of Cho-shi) the Hoshu of Kuon-ji Temple on Mt. Minobu, and the chairman is Nikkan NAGAKURA (hoen of Cho-shi) the Kanju of Hongaku-ji Temple on Mt. Myogon, and the office is temporarily located in Komatsubara Kyonin-ji Temple at present.

The president is Nisso UCHINO (hoen of Cho-shi) the Hoshu of Kuon-ji Temple on Mt. Minobu, and the chairman is Nikkan NAGAKURA (hoen of Cho-shi) the Kanju of Hongaku-ji Temple on Mt. Myogon, and the office is temporarily located in Komatsubara Kyonin-ji Temple at present.
